Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] redirects and QuotaEnforcer
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=PtUQrfUrjm-BdPJzzCjERwJUtJQdVl_pOzpFgG4CEiaf
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> It seems there is a serious bug in the QuotaEnforcer module. Redirects (e.g. 302) are not counted so sites with a lot of redirects go way beyond the specified limit. 
> 
> I have seen over 800Mb from a single host with a 10Mb limit
> 
> Its the same weather the QuotaEnforcer is the first or last module in the processor chain
> 
> Are redirects treated in a special way that never gets their content size summed up with all other URIs ?

Tallies per host, server, and group (queue) are kept for both 'successBytes'
(200 response codes) and 'totalBytes' (any response code) -- see
CrawlStateUpdater.innerProcess() and CrawlSubStats.tally().

But, QuotaEnforcer currently only offers an option to set quotas on
the 'success' byte counts. (This is by design, though the help descriptions
in the settings page are misleading.) It was thought that usually,
successes are the figures of most interest, and non-success data would
usually be small in comparison. Clearly, though, you've hit some sites
where this isn't the case.

Are these sites dominated by crawler trap chaff, or is there some
intended pattern of redirects/other-responses that has generated
such a giant success-vs-total size discrepancy?

I've created an RFE to add QuotaEnforcer max settings for the 'total'
tallies:

  [ 1393254 ] 'total' bytes/fetches quota options in QuotaEnforcer
  http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1393254&group_id=73833&atid=539102

It's a pretty simple addition that I'll get into CVS HEAD in the next
week or so.

Thanks for the problem report!

- Gordon @ IA
